question: Which countries share the location of "Beskid Mountains"?
option1: Poland, Slovakia, Czech Republic and Ukraine
answer: Poland, Slovakia, Czech Republic and Ukraine
explanation: Poland, Slovakia, Czech Republic and Ukraine share the location of Beskid Mountains. The Beskids forms the part of the Carpathian Mountain Range. Babia Gora Peak is the highest mountain of this range which is 1725 metres above the sea level. It is bounded by Sudetes and Tatra Mountains. It houses the Beskidy Protected Landscape Area. It is rich in forest and coal.
